newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Rao wins brief respite in "cheating" case.
newsitem.headline: India's Rao wins brief respite in "cheating" case.

text.p: Former Indian prime minister P.V. Narasimha Rao on Monday won a brief respite as the Supreme Court reserved a decision in a criminal "cheating" case in which he has been summoned by a Delhi court to testify.
Until the Supreme Court pronounces its order, Rao cannot be summoned by the lower court, officials said. The Supreme court had not said when it would give its order, they added.
The case in which Rao has been accused of criminal conspiracy involves a business tycoon who says he paid $100,000 to a Rao acquaintance in 1983 in a failed attempt to win a government contract.
